Class Shelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Shelf

public class Shelf extends Object implements Serializable
Class Shelf occupies of calculating the points for adjacent items

  • Constructor Details

    • Shelf

      public Shelf()
      Constructor builds a new matrix of items

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdjacentItemsPoints

      public int calculateAdjacentItemsPoints() throws EmptyShelfException
      is the function that handles the calculation of points the player should get for adjacent items in his shelf
      Returns:
      how many points the player should get from this feature
      Throws:
      EmptyShelfException - if the function is called on a player's empty shelf

    • exploreGraph

      public int exploreGraph(boolean[][] bitMask, boolean[][] visited, int row, int col)
      is a recursive function used during the calculation of points of calculateAdjacentItemsPoints function
      Parameters:
      bitMask - is a mask of bit placed above the shelf
      visited - is a mask of bit placed above the shelf to help the algorithm remember which slots he has already visited
      row - represents the row in the shelf the function should consider
      col - represents the column in the shelf the function should consider
      Returns:
      how many item of one color he found to be adjacent

    • decodePoints

      public int decodePoints(int adjacentTiles)
      is a function used during the calculation of points of calculateAdjacentItemsPoints function
      Parameters:
      adjacentTiles - is the number of item of one color that are adjacent
      Returns:
      how many points should be added based on how many item were adjacent

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      checks whether a shelf is full
      Returns:
      true if a shelf is full, false otherwise

    • insertItems

      public void insertItems(int column, List<Item> items) throws NotEnoughSpaceInColumnException
      inserts a list of items in a column of the shelf
      Parameters:
      column - is the column where the items should be inserted
      items - is the list of items to be inserted
      Throws:
      NotEnoughSpaceInColumnException - if there isn't enough space in a column to insert the amount of items in the list

    • getItemByCoordinates

      public Item getItemByCoordinates(int row, int col)
      Parameters:
      row - the row where we select the item
      col - the column where we select the item
      Returns:
      the item at the coordinates row and col

    • freeSpaces

      public int freeSpaces(int col)
      Parameters:
      col - is the column where we want to check how many slots are left
      Returns:
      the amount of free slots in the selected column

    • setShelfPoints

      public void setShelfPoints()
      sets the points the player has made with the adjacent items rule in the variable shelfPoints

    • getShelfPoints

      public int getShelfPoints()
      Returns:
      the points the player has made with the adjacent items rule in the variable shelfPoints

    • setShelfItem

      public void setShelfItem(int row, int column, Item item)
      Used for test purposes
      Parameters:
      row - the row where we want to set the item
      column - the column where we want to set the item
      item - is the item we want to set

    • checkColumn

      public boolean checkColumn(int numberOfItemsPicked, int column)
      check whether a column has enough free space available to execute a move
      Parameters:
      numberOfItemsPicked - is the number of items that was picked by a player
      column - is the column we are checking the condition for
      Returns:
      true is there is enough space in the column, false otherwise

    • getShelfMatrix

      public Item[][] getShelfMatrix()
      Returns:
      the shelf matrix

    • setShelfMatrix

      public void setShelfMatrix(Item[][] shelfMatrix)
      used when the controller is restoring a previous game
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is the shelfMatrix of the previous game, that now will be set as the current shelfMatrix
